intro: Seseli montanum var. glaucum, commonly known as mountain seseli, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glaucous leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Europe, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native range.
